intro: Selliguea brachypodia, commonly known as the short-stemmed rock tamarisk, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that typically grows on moist rock surfaces in temperate regions. The plant has a creeping growth habit with small, closely packed leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, white powder. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forested areas or along streams. Selliguea brachypodia plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various invertebrates.
